section.title: Viewing Links output in Widgets
section.p: If you have installed the Links Plugin for Sonar correctly, there are two widgets available for you to use:

The Docfacto Links Summary Widget gives a summary of the Links output. It shows the percentage of source lines which have been linked to documentation, along with other simple statistics. There is a pie chart that shows the percentage of the source lines which have been linked to doc (the section in green and labeled with 'With Doc') and the percentage of source lines which have not been linked to documentation (the section in red and labeled with 'Without Doc').
The Docfacto Links Statistics Widget lists all the measures from Links.

To enable the widgets, login to Sonar as admin and either go to the main 'Dashboards' page or the Dashboard for a specific project by clicking on the project in the main Dashboards page under 'Projects'.

Then click on 'Configure Widgets' on the top right of the page, and scroll down to find the two Docfacto Links widgets, then add the widgets you want.
Adding the Sonar Docfacto Links widgets
The Docfacto Links Summary widget
The Docfacto Links Statistics widget
If you added the widget at the main 'Dashboards' page, then a 'Project' dropdown will appear for the widget and you need to type in the name of the project you want to see the Links metric results for, select it and save.
